III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth has been bullied by two other youth at the facility. The
youth are threatening to physically harm this youth and have
made attempts. Staff are not responding appropriately and have
continued to allow the youth in the same classroom together.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 4, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth
2

A described being attacked by Youth B on August 19, 2024, while
in the classroom. Youth A stated she was sitting in a chair doing
paperwork when Youth B told Youth A’s caseworker, Youth A was
messing with Youth B. Youth A denied doing anything to Youth B.
Youth A reported Youth B trashed Youth A’s journal, messed up
all of Youth A’s paperwork, and threatened to “blow her shit up.”
Youth A stated Staff 1, Staff 2, and Teacher were all in the
classroom just watching and did nothing to stop Youth B. Youth A
reported she went to get up out of the chair, realized she could not
do anything and that is when Youth B punched her in the face.
Youth A stated she did not recall getting punched, but Teacher
told her it was a “glance blow.” Youth A described a glance blow
as a punch that does not really connect with the person but
brushes past the person. Youth A stated Youth C was also in the
classroom during this time. Youth A reported staff had time to
physically intervene but did nothing to stop Youth B. Youth A
stated Staff 3 was outside the classroom and saw the whole
situation. Youth A denied going to see the nurse or having any
marks or injury.
Youth A described after the event Youth B was moved to a
different unit. Youth A stated she has not been alone with Youth
B and staff are always around. Youth A reported prior to the
classroom incident Youth A and Youth B would verbally argue
back and forth but denied anything ever getting physical. Youth A
stated prior to being attacked in the classroom by Youth B she told
every staff she could she felt threatened and was worried about
her safety. Youth A reported staff would hear Youth B threaten
Youth A but would ignore the threats and not do anything to
intervene. Youth A stated Staff 4, Staff 5, and Staff 6 heard Youth
B make the threats.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 4, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth
B reported she was in the same unit as Youth A but after getting
into a fight, Youth B was moved to a different unit. Youth B stated
Youth A is “always bugging me and fittin to get in a physical fight.”
Youth B described getting into a fight with Youth A in the
classroom but the “problem is over and taken care of.” Youth B
reported it was only a verbal fight but they both threatened one
another. Youth B stated, “staff did not do shit.” Youth B refused
to answer any more questions, said she did not know why she
was being asked these questions and walked out of the room.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at a different facility on
September 11, 2024, by Consultant. Youth C stated Youth A
3

talked crazy and would call youths “black bitches and ghetto
niggas.” Youth C reported Youth A also told Youth B, Youth D,
and Youth F she hoped they got raped which led to Youth B
verbally threatening Youth A. Youth C stated staff (could not
recall who) redirected Youth A and Youth B when they were
making these statements. Youth C described Youth B hitting
Youth A on the side of the face in the classroom. Youth C stated
a female staff (could not recall who) redirected Youth B saying,
“let’s go” and staff and Youth B left the classroom. Youth C stated
Youth B walked out of the classroom on her own. Youth C stated
the teacher and Staff 1 were in the classroom but did not
intervene. Youth C reported Youth D, Youth E, and Youth F were
also in the classroom. Youth C denied ever getting into a fight
with Youth A.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 11, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Youth D described being in the classroom with the teacher, a
female staff (could not recall who), and Youth A when Youth B
walked into the classroom, told Youth A to “stand up or you’re
getting your shit blown out”, punched Youth A then walked out of
the classroom. Youth D reported the staff was sitting at a table
and did not intervene. Youth D stated the incident took about five
seconds. Youth D described Youth A as being “weird” and always
saying things to other youth to get them upset. Youth D stated
Youth B was mad at Youth A for saying stuff and started an
argument. Youth D denied seeing Youth A and Youth B ever
physically fight prior to the classroom incident. Youth D denied
knowing what Youth A and Youth B were arguing about.
Youth D reported staff try and stop youth from fighting by getting
in-between them or will redirect youth when something mean is
said. Youth D stated staff cannot really do anything when youth
say something to one another. Youth D reported youth will lose
points or not be able to go on outings.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 11, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff
3 described being outside with Youth B who was threatening to
beat up Youth A over something Youth A said to Youth B earlier.
Staff 3 reported Youth B took off running, went through the double
doors of the building and into the classroom where Youth A was in
school. Staff 3 stated she ran after Youth B, but Youth B was
faster than Staff 3. Staff 3 reported when she entered the
classroom, she had Youth B walk out of the classroom with her.
Staff 3 denied seeing Youth B punch Youth A but stated Youth B
4

entered the classroom prior to Staff 3 getting into the classroom.
Staff 3 reported Teacher was in the classroom as well as one staff
but could not recall which staff. Staff 3 stated she entered the
classroom seconds after Youth B ran into the classroom. Staff 3
reported she is not sure if the staff in the classroom could have
made it to Youth A or Youth B to prevent the situation because it
was so quick.
Staff 3 reported Youth A was upset after getting punched and
wanted to go for a walk. Staff 3 stated Staff 2 talked with Youth A
and Staff 4 went for a walk with Youth A and stayed with Youth A.
Staff 3 reported this was the only time she was aware of Youth A
and Youth B becoming physical with one another. Staff 3 stated
there was a mediation between Youth A and Youth B to have
them talk through their issues. Staff 3 reported there have not
been any other incidents between Youth A and Youth B as they
are in different classrooms and units now.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on September 13, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 denied being in the
classroom when Youth B punched Youth A but entered the
classroom right after the incident. Staff 2 reported when he
walked into the classroom Youth B was outside the classroom
hitting the window and Youth A said Youth B hit her. Staff 2
described the classroom door was locked so Youth B could not re-
enter the room and Staff 3 was with Youth B.
Staff 2 reported this is the first time he is aware of Youth A and
Youth B physically fighting. Staff 2 described Youth A as being
very mouthy toward her peers, saying mean things and then gets
bullied. Staff 2 reported staff give directive statements to redirect
the youth and try and stop the youth statements. Staff 2 stated
Youth A and Youth B are no longer in the same unit. Staff 2
reported he feels staff take it seriously and respond well with
redirecting youth when they are making threatening comments.
Staff 7 was interviewed via telephone on September 13, 2024,
in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 7 denied being in the
classroom but stated she was in the hallway when Youth B came
out of the classroom after the incident. Staff 7 reported the only
time she ever heard Youth B threaten Youth A was right after the
incident in the classroom. Staff 7 stated Staff 3 was with Youth B
trying to help her calm down and talk to her therapist. Staff 7
reported Youth B would have verbal outbursts toward Youth A for
not cleaning up the unit but never threatened Youth A. Staff 7
stated after the incident in the classroom Youth A and Youth B
5

were separated and moved units soon after. Staff 7 reported staff
were informed by Staff 3 there were issues between Youth A and
Youth B. Staff 7 stated this was the first time Youth A and Youth
B got into a physical altercation with one another.
Staff 7 reported Youth A described Youth B and Youth C being
“ghetto” and that she did not want to be in a unit with a “bunch of
ghetto bitches.” Staff 7 stated Youth A made these comments two
to three days prior to the classroom incident and the comments
were made in front of Youth B and Youth C. Staff 7 reported the
morning of the classroom incident there was “nothing brewing and
no threats to fight prior to class.” Staff 7 denied having a
conversation with Youth B and/or Youth C about Youth A calling
them “ghetto bitches.” Staff 7 reported she only told Staff 3 about
the comments.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at McDonalds on
September 25, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff
1 stated Youth B entered the classroom and swung on Youth A
but did not connect with Youth A. Staff 1 reported Youth A was
sitting on the edge of her chair and moved back, away from the
punch and ended up falling off the chair. Staff 1 reported after
Youth B tried to punch Youth A, Youth B left the classroom. Staff
1 reported she was in the classroom with Teacher when the
incident took place. Staff 1 described moving to separate Youth A
and Youth B but Youth B entering the classroom and punching
Youth A happened “very fast.” Staff 1 stated she was unaware
Youth B was going to come into the classroom and punch Youth
A. Staff 1 stated she stayed in the classroom with Youth A while
Staff 2 or Staff 7 (could not recall what staff) went with Youth B.
Staff 1 reported after the incident between Youth A and Youth B
the girls were separated, and staff were informed by Staff 2 to
keep a close eye on both youths. Staff 1 stated this is the first
time Youth A and Youth B have been physical towards one
another.
Video Review
Video footage of 08/19/24 was reviewed on 09/11/24. Video
shows Staff 1 standing at a table looking at a book, Youth D
standing at a table looking at a computer and Youth A sitting
backwards in a chair. Staff 1 has two rectangular tables between
herself and Youth A. Youth B enters the classroom, walks over to
Youth A, appears to say something to Youth A then swings her
arm towards Youth A (within 4 seconds of Youth B entering the
room). Staff 1 moves around the table toward Youth A and Youth
B as Staff 3 enters the classroom. Staff 1 steps in between Youth
6

A and Youth B while Staff 3 guides Youth B away from Youth A to
the other side of the classroom and eventually out the back door.
Staff 1 follows Youth A out the side classroom door approximately
14 seconds after Youth B entered the classroom. Youth B is in
the classroom for approximately 24 seconds.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record.
• Youth Care Worker Supervisor Communication Logbook:
Documents Youth B trying to punch Youth A.
• Unit placement sheet of all youth at facility; 8/28/24
documents Youth B moved to a different unit separate from
Youth A.
• Internal incident report of altercation between Youth A and
Youth B: consistent with youth and staff interviews and
video.
• Behavior Support and Management Policy: Policy states,
“The focus is to provide immediate emotional and
environmental support to clients in crisis so that stress and
the risk for violence are reduced.”
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review, staff separated Youth A and Youth B
and acted as quickly as they could during the four seconds Youth
B entered the classroom and swung at Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
